Text: Republicans want to lower the corporate tax rate while raising taxes on millions in the middle class. The #GOPTaxPlan is bad for working families.

Residents of MA’s 8th District claim an average of $15,000 in state and local tax deductions. The #GOPTaxPlan would eliminate the itemized deduction for these taxes, disproportionally hurting residents of MA and other high-tax states.

This week I cosponsored House Resolution 630, which requires members of Congress and employees to complete workplace harassment training. This won’t end harassment, but it’s an important first step to making necessary changes to the current system. http://bit.ly/2zzjcv7
Tune in to Channel 5 at 11am today: I'll be talking to @WuWCVB and @EdWCVB during WCVB's On the Record.pic.twitter.com/HFBk5Dje1q

Taking away #NetNeutrality gives telecom companies control over which websites and services consumers can access. We should NOT be handing power to major cable companies at the expense of public access to information.
I support free, open, equal and democratic access to the web and oppose any attempts by the FCC to repeal #NetNeutralityِ rules.

Happy #Thanksgiving. While we have much to be thankful for in our country, it is a time to remember those who may be struggling. I am very thankful for the opportunity to serve the families of the 8th Congressional District of Massachusetts.

Seniors spend nearly 20% of their income on health care expenses. The #GOPTaxPlan would eliminate the medical expense deduction many seniors use to get relief from their medical bills.

We should be working together to come up with a tax plan that benefits the middle class and hard working families. Instead Republicans are helping corporations and the wealthy by jamming the #GOPTaxPlan through Congress.
The #GOPTaxPlan gives tax breaks to corporations on the backs of hard working, middle class Americans.
Homebuyers in MA would be hit hard by the #GOPTaxPlan, which would eliminate the mortgage interest deduction above $500k
36 million middle class working families will see tax increases under the #GOPTaxPlan
The #GOPTaxPlan hurts middle-class families in MA by repealing state and local tax deduction, which is claimed by 1/3 MA residents
It is time for Congress to take action and pass common-sense gun legislation. These tragedies are preventable. We must do our jobs and protect American lives.
No single law will prevent gun violence, but we owe it to victims and their families to act. Common-sense gun control legislation will make Americans safer.
There was another tragic shooting yesterday. As we pray for the victims and their families, we must adopt common-sense gun laws to stop this violence.

Met today with the FAA to discuss aircraft noise in residential areas. It is imperative that we understand and remedy the impacts to public health and quality of life caused by aircraft flying over communities.pic.twitter.com/QewGZ6NKd5

This week I introduced a bill that would suspend construction of natural gas facilities in communities with unsafe air pollutant levels. If the air quality in a community already violates federal standards, we should not be adding more toxins to the air. http://bit.ly/2mtQ3zB

Victims of gun violence can’t speak for themselves so it is our job to speak on their behalf and on behalf of their families.

The second bill says we should check on the background of people to determine they can handle the responsibility of having a weapon.
The first bill is pretty simple – people on the terrorist watchlist shouldn’t have access to weapons.

Discussion draft of the bipartisan postal reform legislation is now available online:https://oversight.house.gov/postalreform/
Thank @USPS 4 major postal employee unions & key mailing industry associations for coming together on joint proposal of Medicare integration
It would also reduce expenses by $38 billion over the next 10 years.
Medicare integrationwould eliminate 94% of the Postal Service’s unfunded retiree health benefit liability.
Medicare integration would eliminate onerousrequirement from 2006 that the Postal Service prefund healthcare costs for future retirees.
Agreement would establish postal-specific health plans within FEHBP that would be fully integrated with Medicare beginning in January 2018.
This is costly for the Postal Service and its employees/retirees becausenon-participation shifts claim costs from Medicare to FEHBP.
However, postal employees are not currently required to enroll in Medicare once they are eligible.
Postal employees and retirees have paid over $29.4 billion into Medicare but are not drawing on the benefits that they’ve alreadypaid for.
The Postal Service currently spends approximately 20 cents of every revenue dollar on healthcare.
In Fiscal Year 2015, the Postal Service reported total healthcare costs of $13.6 B including $8.8 B in retiree health costs alone.

In case you missed it, I voiced my serious concerns with the #TPP trade negotiations today on the House Floor.https://amp.twimg.com/v/1f284f7e-c2be-40e3-badb-f0d8233f468f …
I have 727,514 bosses back in Massachusetts. They sent me here to do my job & I’m trying to do that on their behalf.pic.twitter.com/LAAX0LER6y
We need to give the American worker a voice. Let’s have an open debate. It should not be a national secret.
My constituents sent me here to do my job and I’m trying to do that on their behalf. We can’t do that if #TPA goes through.
Let's have a fair deal for the American worker that I can read and share with my constituents.
I’m not against free trade. I think free trade works when it’s balanced, but the #TPP is a lousy deal.
Let's vote this #TAA bill down. Stop #TPA and be involved in the process.
We are leaving it up to multinational corporations. America wants their representatives back in the fight.
It is unacceptable that the people who represent American workers have been kept out of the #TPP process.
I would rather have my Representative fighting for my job than fighting for a public assistance program after I lose my job.
I oppose this bill because I want a stronger America. Our trade agreements have a continual pattern of exporting American jobs overseas.
